trans-unit.source: The abstract base class that defines methods for serializing and deserializing versions of WS-Trust request (RST) messages.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.WSTrustRequestSerializer"></xref> class.
When overridden in a derived class, checks if the specified XML reader is positioned at a WS-Trust RequestSecurityToken element.
The <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> object from which to read.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the reader is positioned at an RST element that the serializer can read; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Creates an instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityToken"></xref> class that this class can serialize or deserialize.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityToken"></xref> object.
When overridden in a derived class, reads a custom element.
The default implementation throws a <xref:System.NotSupportedException>.
The <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> object positioned on the current element.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.WSTrustSerializationContext"></xref> that contains the current serialization context.
When overridden in a derived class, deserializes the RST from an <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> object to a <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityToken"></xref> object.
The XML reader over the RST.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.WSTrustSerializationContext"></xref> that contains the current serialization context.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityToken"></xref> object if the deserialization was successful.
When overridden in a derived class, reads a child element inside the RST.
An <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> object positioned at an element to read inside the RST.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityToken"></xref> object that is being populated from the reader.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.WSTrustSerializationContext"></xref> that contains the current serialization context.
Validates the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityToken"></xref> object that has been deserialized.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityToken"></xref> object to validate.
requestSecurityToken is .
A WS-Trust Issue request for an asymmetric key did not specify the UseKey element.
When overridden in a derived class, writes the supported elements on the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityToken"></xref> object to the stream.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityToken"></xref> object being serialized.
The <xref:System.Xml.XmlWriter> object to write to.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.WSTrustSerializationContext"></xref> that contains the current serialization context.
When overridden in a derived class, serializes the specified <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityToken"></xref> object into the <xref:System.Xml.XmlWriter> object.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityToken"></xref> object to be serialized.
The <xref:System.Xml.XmlWriter> object to write to.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.WSTrustSerializationContext"></xref> that contains the current serialization context.
When overridden in a derived class, writes a child element inside the RST.
The <xref:System.Xml.XmlWriter> object to which the RST is being serialized.
The local name of the element to be written.
The value of the element.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityToken"></xref> object that is being serialized.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.WSTrustSerializationContext"></xref> that contains the current serialization context.
